page.title: 17THE LIFEBOAT
page.content: IN JULY 1974 , THE LIFEBOAT , THE JANE HAY SAILED SADLY OUT OF ST ABBS HARBOUR FOR THE LAST TIME . SHE WAS TO BE REPLACED BY A PROTOTYPE TWIN-ENGINED ZODIAC MARK IV. AN INSHORE RESCUE BOAT . IT WAS THE END OF AN ERA FOR THE FISHERMEN OF ST ABBS, AS MANY OF THE FISHERMEN HAD SERVED AS CREW MEMBERS OF THE LIFEBOAT AS HAD THEIR PREDECESSORS .A LIFEBOAT STATION HAD BEEN ESTABLISHED AT ST ABBS ON 25 APRIL, 1911 WITH THE COMMISSIONING OF THE HELEN SMITTON. THREE OTHER BOATS WERE TO SERVE THE SEAMEN DURING THE NEXT SEVENTY YEARS AND OVER FIFTY RESCUES WERE SUCCESSFULLY CARRIED OUT. OVER 130 LIVES WERE SAVED AT SEA ALONE WHILE THE LIFEBOAT ALSO HELPED WITH RESCUES OF PEOPLE FROM THE CLIFFS AS WELL AS RESCUING SHEEP WHICH HAD SLIPPED OVER.
